[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Factory Management System (FMS) defines requirements for managing furniture production, components, sales, and orders.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: FMS supports inventory, component tracking, order processing, and manufacturing coordination across factories and stores.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: FMS integrates with inventory, sales, and production systems for real-time tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: FMS offers dashboards for inventory, production, and order tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: FMS supports manufacturing machinery, barcode scanners, and POS systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: FMS connects with ERP, warehouse, and logistics systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: FMS secures data with HTTPS, TLS encryption, and authentication protocols.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: FMS optimizes storage for inventory, orders, and production data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: FMS enables real-time tracking and scheduled maintenance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: FMS is configurable for multiple locations and product lines.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: FMS integrates with suppliers, logistics, and third-party distribution.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: FMS manages production, component tracking, inventory, sales, and order fulfillment.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: FMS serves factory managers, production supervisors, warehouse staff, and store personnel.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: FMS requires internet connectivity for real-time synchronization.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: FMS relies on warehouse, sales, and supply chain databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Furniture Line: A classification of products.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with store databases for tracking sales and stock levels.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall communicate with warehouses to update inventory and manage restocking.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall manage furniture lines and product variations (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall track components by numerical codes, type, and price (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall process orders, storing order details including number, store, date, furniture list, and quantities (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an interface for inventory and orders (REQ-FUNC-001, REQ-FUNC-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall allow stores to place and review orders through an interactive dashboard (REQ-FUNC-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall update inventory in 3 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall load data in 2 seconds (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store furniture catalogs, components, and order records.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce unique identification for furniture, components, and orders.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with supply chain and inventory standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log stock movements, order changes, and production updates.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests for furniture tracking, component management, and order processing.
[SEC] 5. References: Supply chain management policies and inventory control standards.
